ygData.subject: Re: Re: New Record
ygData.msgSnippet: When I fell off the first cliff out of HighHold, into the umm..abyss, in East K., I took 9845 damage (I wrote it down, hehe)  Of course, being a level 4 or 5
ygData.messageBody:
When I fell off the first cliff out of HighHold, into the umm..abyss, in
East K., I took 9845 damage (I wrote it down, hehe) Of course, being a
level 4 or 5 bard, I died instantly. I still get nervous when traveling
down that &^%$&^% ramp. For the record, I made it through high-hold 15 or
20 times before I went on my dying streak. For some reason, I kept running
into those bandits, just opposite the keep. Took me a LONG time to get
straightened out on what path to take out of there. after about 6 or 8
deaths, I quit going that way, and usually go through
rivervale,misty,runnyeye,gorge to east k. And I usually wander through
misty, giving some newbies a bit of help on the way. Hehe, it's funny
putting a rat to sleep, and watching a level 1 or 2 swing, swing, swing,
hit, rat hits, nod, swing, swing, swing, hit, rat hits, nod, etc. Try it
sometime >8^)

MacGrough
17th Song Bard (finally)
Solusek Ro Wanderers

-----Original Message-----
From: Darrian Ashoka <dashoka@...>
To: eqbards@onelist.com <eqbards@onelist.com>
Date: Monday, September 13, 1999 10:52 AM
Subject: [eqbards] Re: New Record


>From: Darrian Ashoka <dashoka@...>
>
>
>I think you can do better in Dagnor's Cauldron if
>you tried.
>And I don't think all 10K dmg are bugs.
>If you fall off the the highest cliff in East Karana
>you take about that much damage. Yes, this is from
>personally experience.
>
>Note to self: Don't reach for a drink when you're
>running in that area again.
>
>
>Darrian Ashoka
